cuisines: Tawa Fry Fish is a spicy and flavorful South Indian-style fish preparation where marinated fish pieces are lightly shallow-fried on a tawa (flat pan) and then coated in a rich masala made with onions, coconut milk, tamarind, and aromatic spices. The dish combines crisp textures with tangy and creamy flavors, making it a perfect side or main for rice or flatbreads.
method: Combine all marination ingredients and coat cleaned fish pieces. Let them marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat 1–2 tbsp oil in a tawa or shallow frying pan. Lightly fry both sides of the marinated fish until half-cooked. Set aside.
In the same pan, add 1 tbsp oil and sauté crushed pearl onions, ginger, and garlic until golden.
Add the masala powders (Kashmiri chilli, turmeric, coriander, garam masala) and fry for 2–3 minutes until raw smell disappears.
Stir in salt and tamarind paste, then pour in coconut milk (start with 1/3 cup) and mix well.
Add the half-fried fish pieces to the masala and gently coat them. Add more coconut milk if needed.
Cook on low flame until the masala thickens and coats the fish well. The consistency should be semi-dry.
Serve hot with rice, roti, or paratha.

label: Masala Puri Lemon Pickle
description: Masala puri is a Bangalore-style chaat made with puris or papdis, a spicy masala, and various chutneys and other toppings.Here's a recipe for masala puri that includes lemon juice in the spicy water.
cuisines: Masala Puri Lemon Pickle is a tangy and spicy Indian street food made with crisp puris, spicy gravy, lemon juice, fresh vegetables, and savory toppings.
method: Make the puris: Mix semolina, all-purpose flour, salt, and baking soda in a bowl, divide into balls, and roll out into puris.
Make the filling: Mash potatoes, boil chickpeas, and mix with roasted cumin powder, chaat masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Make the spicy water: Mix water, tamarind chutney, mint chutney, lemon juice, and salt.
Prepare the toppings: Chop onions, tomatoes, lemon, and coriander leaves.
Assemble: Gently tap a hole in the top of each puri, pour in the spicy water, and add the filling and toppings.
Serve immediately before the puris soften.

label: Vegetable Pulao
description: Vegetable pulao is a popular rice dish from South Asia, Central Asia, and the Middle East that can be made with a variety of vegetables.You can also add garam masala powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder.
cuisines: Vegetable Pulao is a fragrant and colorful Indian rice dish cooked with mixed vegetables, aromatic spices, and herbs for a wholesome and flavorful meal.
method: Slice onions thin and shred vegetables.
Cook rice separately and set aside.
Heat oil or ghee in a wide pan and add onions.
When onions start to brown, add cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom.
Stir fry until onions are darker brown, then add minced garlic and fry for a few seconds.
Add shredded vegetables, green chilies, salt, and chaat masala; cover and cook on low heat until vegetables are soft.
Mix in cooked rice and garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Turn off the heat and keep partially covered until ready to serve.

label: Aloo Sandwich
description: An aloo sandwich typically makes four servings, and uses eight slices of bread. Aloo sandwiches can be made with a variety of ingredients, including potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and spices.
cuisines: Aloo Sandwich is a popular Indian street-style snack made with spiced mashed potato filling, layered between bread slices, and toasted until golden brown.
method: Mash boiled potatoes and mix with chopped onions, coriander, green chilies, chili powder, chaat masala, lemon juice, and salt.
Spread butter on both bread slices. Spread green chutney on one slice and tomato sauce on the other if desired.
Spread the potato filling generously on the chutney-coated slice.
Top with grated cheese if using.
Cover with the second bread slice and press gently.
Place on a heated skillet or tawa, buttered side down. Toast 1–2 minutes until golden brown.
Flip and toast the other side until golden.
Cut in half and serve hot.

label: Idli With Coconet Chutney
description: Idli is often served with coconut chutney, a condiment that originated in India and is commonly eaten with other South Indian breakfast dishes like dosa, vada, and upma.
cuisines: Idli with Coconut Chutney is a classic South Indian breakfast dish where soft, steamed rice cakes are served with a creamy, mildly spiced coconut-based chutney.
method: Add grated coconut, fried gram, cumin seeds, green chilies, and salt to a blender or chutney jar.
Blend until well combined, scraping down the sides as needed.
Add water gradually and blend until smooth and thick.
Taste and adjust salt or green chilies according to preference.
Transfer to a serving bowl and serve with hot idlis.

label: Bharwa Aloo Kachori
description: Aloo kachori, or potato kachori, is a deep-fried flatbread stuffed with a spicy potato filling. It's a popular breakfast snack in Northern India, especially in Mathura-Vrindavan in Uttar Pradesh, and is often served with aloo sabzi, curd, chutneys, or pumpkin sabzi.
cuisines: Bharwa Aloo Kachori is a crispy, deep-fried Indian snack stuffed with a spiced potato and pea mixture, flavored with aromatic spices and herbs, often served with chutney.
method: Sift flour and semolina into a bowl, then add salt, baking powder, and oil. Mix well by hand.
Gradually knead with lukewarm water to form a dough. Cover and rest for 20–30 minutes.
Boil potatoes, peel them, and break into small pieces.
Heat oil in a wok and add cumin seeds until they crackle.
Add coriander powder, green chilies, grated ginger, and salt. Mix well.
Add boiled potatoes, green peas, onions, and other spices. Stir to combine.
Pinch off a small portion of dough, flatten with a rolling pin, and place about 1 tablespoon of filling in the center.
Fold and seal the edges, shaping into a ball. Gently press to flatten slightly.
Heat oil in a deep pot over low to medium heat.
Carefully lower the kachoris into the oil and fry until golden brown on both sides.
Remove using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil.
Serve hot with chutney.

label: Vegetable Nuts Uttapam
description: Vegetable uttapam is a dish made with a batter and a variety of vegetables, and sometimes nuts.Uttapam is high in fiber and low in calories, and it contains vitamins, minerals, protein, and heart-healthy fats.
cuisines: Vegetable Nuts Uttapam is a South Indian-style thick pancake made from dosa batter, topped with fresh vegetables, roasted peanut powder, and sesame seeds, cooked until golden and served with chutney.

ingredients.item: Mixed vegetables (grated - carrots, cabbage, cauliflower, onions)

method: Bring dosa batter to room temperature.
Heat a non-stick tawa or griddle over medium-high heat.
Grease lightly with oil.
Pour a ladleful of batter into the center and spread slightly to form a thick pancake.
Sprinkle grated vegetables, roasted peanut powder, coriander, sesame seeds, salt, sugar, and chili powder on top.
Drizzle with a few drops of oil.
Cover and cook for 2–3 minutes until small bubbles appear on the surface.
Flip and cook until golden brown on the other side.
Serve hot with chutney.

label: Dahi Suji Cheela
description: Suji dahi chilla, also known as rava chilla or suji ka cheela, is a healthy and tasty breakfast dish made with semolina, yogurt, and other ingredients.
cuisines: Dahi Suji Cheela is a healthy, savory Indian pancake made with semolina, yogurt, and fresh vegetables, spiced with aromatic herbs and roasted to golden perfection, ideal for breakfast or a light snack.
method: In a blender, puree semolina, yogurt, and water until smooth.
Add chopped onions, tomatoes, carrots, green chili, coriander leaves, and ginger-green chili paste.
Season with salt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, and black pepper powder.
Let the batter rest for 20 minutes to allow the semolina to swell.
If needed, add more water to make the batter thick yet flowable.
Heat a non-stick tawa and grease lightly with oil.
Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it into a round cheela shape.
Cook on medium heat until golden brown on one side, then flip and cook the other side.
Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.
Optional: Add vegetables like beets or cabbage for extra nutrition.
For softer cheelas, soak the semolina in water overnight in the refrigerator before making the batter.

label: Malai Fruit's Sandwich
description: Malai sandwiches are a popular Indian street food that can be made with a variety of fillings, bread, and clotted cream (malai). The bread is spread with malai and then filled with a mixture of vegetables, cheese, and spices, and then grilled or toasted until golden and crispy.
cuisines: Malai Fruit's Sandwich is a rich, creamy, and flavorful snack made with fresh vegetables, cream, and spices layered between bread slices and grilled until golden brown, perfect for breakfast or evening tea.
method: In a large bowl, combine grated carrot, cabbage, capsicum, onion, sweet corn, and coriander leaves.
Add cream, pepper powder, chilli flakes, and mixed herbs; mix well to form the vegetable malai mixture.
Spread butter and green chutney on one side of each bread slice.
Spread 2 tbsp of the vegetable malai mixture on half of the bread slices.
Sprinkle grated cheese over the mixture.
Cover with the remaining bread slices.
Spread butter on the outer sides of the sandwiches.
Grill until golden brown on both sides.
Cut each sandwich into two triangles and serve hot with tomato ketchup and green chutney.

label: Daliya
description: Daliya, also known as broken wheat or porridge, is a cracked wheat foodstuff that's a staple breakfast in many Indian households. It's a good source of protein and low in fat, and can be prepared in many ways.
cuisines: Daliya is a wholesome and versatile Indian dish made with cracked wheat, lentils, and vegetables, often prepared either sweet with milk, sugar, and dry fruits, or savory as a healthy upma or pulao.
method: You can replace sugar with jaggery, but avoid adding hot milk to jaggery to prevent curdling.
For meal prep, cook dalia without milk, store in the fridge, and reheat before serving.
For sweet dalia, add crushed almonds and cardamom powder.
For savory dalia upma, cook with cumin seeds, hing, onion, curry leaves, and green chili.
Dalia can also be used to make pulao with vegetables and proteins like paneer.

label: Poha
description: Poha, also known as flattened rice, is a popular Indian breakfast dish that originated in Northern India. It's made from parboiled and pressed rice that requires little to no cooking.
cuisines: Poha is a light and healthy Indian breakfast dish made with flattened rice, peanuts, onions, peas, and mild spices, often garnished with curry leaves and lime juice.
method: Rinse poha in a strainer with running water 2–3 times until softened, but not mushy.
Sprinkle salt, sugar, and turmeric powder over the poha and mix gently.
Cover and let the poha soften for a few minutes; test by pressing flakes between fingers.
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds; let them splutter.
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and peanuts; roast until peanuts are crisp.
Add chopped onions and green peas; sauté until onions are translucent.
Add softened poha to the pan and stir gently.
Cook for 1–2 minutes, adjust salt and sugar if needed.
Cover and steam for another 2 minutes.
Turn off the heat, drizzle with lime juice, and serve hot.

label: Vegetable Khichdi
description: Khichdi is often eaten by babies and people who are sick because it soothes the stomach and intestines. It's also part of the Ayurvedic diet because it balances the three doshas, or energies, of Vatta, Pitta, and Kapha.
cuisines: Vegetable Khichdi is a wholesome Indian comfort dish made with rice, toor dal, and a mix of vegetables, flavored with spices and cooked to a soft, porridge-like consistency.
method: Dry roast moong dal over low to medium heat until lightly golden.
Rinse and soak the lentils in hot water for 30–40 minutes.
Chop all the vegetables.
Sauté the vegetables in ghee for 3–4 minutes over medium heat.
Add broken rice, turmeric powder, chili powder, and garam masala.
Sauté for 2–3 minutes.
Add 2 cups of water and bring to a boil.
Cover and cook for 10–15 minutes over low heat until rice is tender and most water is absorbed.
Serve hot with raita, pickle, plain curd, or veggie salad, and garnish with coriander leaves.

label: Dal And Rice
description: Dal chawal, or dal and rice, is a traditional North Indian dish that's a staple of the Indian diet. It's a complete meal that's high in fiber, low in calories, and fat free except for any added oil or ghee. Dal chawal is also a good source of protein, vitamins, calcium, and carbs.
cuisines: Dal and Rice is a simple and comforting Indian meal made by cooking toor dal and rice together with onions, tomatoes, and aromatic spices.

ingredients.item: Mustard seeds, urad dal, channa dal, jeera

method: Heat oil in a tava and add mustard seeds, urad dal, jeera, and channa dal.
Let them splutter, then add curry leaves and green chillies.
Chop onions and tomatoes and add them to the tava.
Add turmeric powder and salt, then sauté for a few minutes.
Add coriander leaves to the mixture and mix well.
In a thick-bottomed vessel used for cooking rice, add dal and rice with the required amount of water.
Add the sautéed mixture to the dal and rice, mix well.
Place in a pressure cooker and cook for 4 whistles.
Serve hot with papad or pickle.

label: Egg Roll
description: These homemade Egg Rolls are crisp on the outside with a satisfying pork and vegetable filling. Learn the secrets to an ultra-crisp shell. Watch the video recipe and learn how to make egg rolls that are better than takeout.
cuisines: Egg Roll is a popular street food made with a thin flatbread, eggs, vegetables, and tangy seasonings, rolled into a handheld snack.
method: Leave a border around the edges of the wrapper and spoon a few spoonfuls of filling in the center.
Fold the bottom corner over the filling and tuck it under slightly.
Fold the left and right corners over the middle to form an envelope.
Lightly dab the top corner with beaten egg to help seal.
Tightly roll the wrapper from the bottom to the top to seal the egg roll.
Heat vegetable oil to around 350°F (175°C) in a deep pan.
Place a couple of egg rolls seam side down into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.

label: Curd Rice
description: Curd rice, also known as dahi chawal or thayir sadam in Hindi and Tamil, is a dish that originated in South India and is eaten throughout the country. It's made with precooked rice, yogurt, herbs, and spices, and is often eaten with pickles.
cuisines: Curd Rice is a comforting South Indian dish made with cooked rice mixed with yogurt, tempered spices, and vegetables, served chilled or at room temperature for a refreshing meal.
method: Wash rice and millet rice, then pressure cook with 1 3/4 cups of water for 5 whistles on medium heat.
Mash the hot rice well, then mix in boiled milk and butter (optional).
Let the rice cool slightly, then add yogurt and mix until smooth.
Add grated carrot, grated cucumber, and salt to taste, mixing well.
Heat oil in a small pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, chana dal, urad dal, dried red chili, and curry leaves for tempering.
Pour the tempering over the rice-yogurt mixture, stir well, and serve chilled or at room temperature.

label: Rava Dosa
description: Rava dosa can also be made with vegetables like carrots, cilantro, and onions. One variation is onion rava dosa, which includes finely chopped onions in the batter for a crispy dosa with a subtle onion flavor.
cuisines: Rava Dosa is a thin, crispy South Indian crepe made from semolina, rice flour, and spices, prepared with a watery batter and cooked until golden brown, often served with chutney and sambar.
method: In a mixing bowl, combine rava, rice flour, and all-purpose flour.
Add cumin seeds, green chili, grated ginger, crushed black pepper, chopped curry leaves, coriander leaves, and onion.
Add yogurt and pour in water to make a thin, watery batter. Mix well and rest for 10–15 minutes.
Heat a heavy-bottomed pan or well-seasoned cast-iron tawa on medium heat.
Grease the pan and rub it with an onion slice before pouring batter.
Pour the batter from a height so it spreads naturally into thin holes.
Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges and cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

label: Besan Ka Cheela
description: We've taken our basic fish fry to another level, the fish is fried yet it's succulent and coconut milk and tamarind and other spices come together to make it finger-licking goodness!.
cuisines: Besan Ka Cheela is a savory Indian pancake made from gram flour and finely chopped vegetables, flavored with spices and herbs, and cooked until golden, often served for breakfast or as a light snack.

ingredients.item: Chopped green chilies or serrano pepper
Red chili powder or cayenne pepper

method: In a mixing bowl, add gram flour (besan).
Add finely chopped onions, tomatoes, coriander leaves, green chilies, and ginger.
Add carom seeds, turmeric powder, and red chili powder.
Pour in half a cup of water and whisk until smooth, adding more water if needed for a pourable batter.
Heat a non-stick pan or tawa and lightly grease it.
Pour a ladle of batter and spread it evenly into a thin pancake shape.
Cook on medium flame until the base is light golden, then flip and cook the other side until golden brown.
Serve hot with chutney or yogurt.

label: Aloo Chana Chaat
description: Aloo chana chaat is a dish of boiled potatoes and chickpeas tossed with spices, chutneys, and toppings.
cuisines: Aloo Chana Chaat is a tangy and spicy Indian street food made with boiled potatoes, chickpeas, fresh vegetables, chutneys, and crunchy sev, served as a refreshing and flavorful snack.
method: In a mixing bowl, combine chickpeas, boiled potatoes, green chutney, tamarind chutney, curd, salt, and chili powder.
Transfer the mixture to a serving plate.
Crumble papdi over the mixture.
Top with curd, green chutney, and tamarind chutney.
Add chopped onion and tomato.
Sprinkle cumin powder, chili powder, aamchur, chaat masala, and black salt over the chaat.
Top with sev, more onion, and tomato.
Garnish with pomegranate seeds and chopped coriander before serving.

label: Tandoori Shashlik Paneer Tikka Chaat
description: Paneer tikka shashlik is a vegetarian Indian dish of paneer cubes marinated in spices and skewered on bamboo skewers. It's a dry appetizer that's similar to chicken tikka, but made with paneer instead of meat.
cuisines: Tandoori Shashlik Paneer Tikka Chaat is a smoky, spiced Indian appetizer made by marinating paneer cubes in yogurt and tandoori spices, skewering them with vegetables, and roasting until charred, then serving as a flavorful chaat.
method: In a bowl, mix yogurt, light cooking oil, tandoori masala, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, fenugreek leaves, and salt to make the marinade.
Add paneer cubes to the marinade and toss until well coated.
Cover and marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
Skewer paneer cubes and vegetables alternately onto skewers or toothpicks.
Preheat the oven to 430°F (220°C) for 10 minutes.
Bake for 15 minutes, turning skewers halfway through cooking.
Turn on the broiler and cook for 2–3 minutes until paneer is lightly charred.
While cooking, baste the paneer with extra marinade or oil using a pastry brush.
Serve hot as a chaat, optionally garnished with chutneys and onions.

label: Roasted Peanut Pea Salad
description: This crunchy and creamy pea and peanut salad is destined to be the belle of the ball at potlucks and cookouts this summer! It's a totally easy side dish filled with sweet peas, crispy bacon, roasted peanuts, chopped celery, and diced red onion dressing.
cuisines: Roasted Peanut Pea Salad is a creamy, crunchy, and refreshing side dish combining sweet green peas, roasted peanuts, and fresh vegetables in a tangy-sweet dressing. Perfect for quick summer gatherings.
method: In a small bowl, mix sour cream, mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, and sugar to prepare the dressing.
Chop celery and red onion.
In a large bowl, combine frozen peas, celery, red onion, roasted peanuts, and crumbled bacon.
Pour the prepared dressing over the mixture.
Toss gently until all ingredients are well coated.
Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.

label: Mint Mango Salad
description: This Mango Salad with Mint is so easy and so delicious! With only 3 ingredients, it comes together in minutes and is so refreshing. Mangoes, mint, and limes are all you need to make this easy side dish salad.
cuisines: Mint Mango Salad is a refreshing tropical blend where sweet mango pairs with fresh mint, tangy lemon, and a hint of chili heat. Tossed in a smooth mango-mint dressing, it delivers a balance of sweetness, spice, and zest.
method: To make the mango dressing, add olive oil, cubed mango, mint leaves, chili flakes, lemon juice, honey, and salt in a food processor.
Blend until smooth.
Add water to thin the dressing if needed.
This dressing yields enough for 3-4 servings.
Assemble chopped mango and vegetables in a salad bowl.
Pour 2 tbsp of the mango-mint dressing over and mix through.
Serve immediately.

label: Roasted Butter Chicken Salad
description: This recipe is all about taking the flavours of butter chicken and turning them into a salad. It's incredibly simple â€“ and you can use chicken thigh or breast. Add 5 minutes roasting time for the chicken thigh.
cuisines: Roasted Butter Chicken Salad combines the smoky tenderness of grilled butter chicken with fresh, crisp vegetables and herbs. Served with lentils and lettuce, and drizzled with warm butter chicken sauce, it’s a hearty yet refreshing salad with Indian-inspired flavors.
method: Preheat a chargrill pan or barbecue grill to medium-high.
Combine the chicken fillets and 2 tbsp butter chicken sauce in a bowl until well coated.
Cook the chicken on the grill for 3-4 minutes on each side or until cooked through.
Set aside to rest.
Divide the lentils, lettuce, and tomatoes among serving plates.
Slice the chicken and place on top.
Drizzle with remaining warmed butter chicken sauce.
Serve immediately.

label: Chaat Ka Lachha Salad
description: Chaat Lachha Salad, also known as Lachha Pyaaz or Masala Pyaaz, is an Indian salad. It is made from freshly cut raw onion rings, ground spices, lemon, and fresh herbs. It is served with appetizers, snacks, or tandoori food.
cuisines: Chaat Ka Lachha Salad is a tangy and spicy Indian onion salad made with thickly sliced onions soaked in ice water for extra crunch, tossed with aromatic spices, fresh herbs, and a splash of lemon juice for zest. It's a refreshing side that pairs perfectly with Indian meals.

ingredients.item: Chopped mint leaves or coriander leaves

method: Peel and wash a large red onion.
Cut the onion into thick roundels.
Separate the onion layers and discard any thin membranes.
Soak the onion in ice water for 15 minutes.
Drain the water and pat dry the onion.
In a bowl, mix together red chili powder, chaat masala, black salt, cumin powder, and salt.
Add chopped green chili, coriander leaves, and the spice mix to the onion.
Squeeze lemon juice over the onion.
Add mustard oil if desired.
Mix well.
Serve immediately.

label: Corn Spinach Salad
description: Chaat Lachha Salad, also known as Lachha Pyaaz or Masala Pyaaz, is an Indian salad. It is made from freshly cut raw onion rings, ground spices, lemon, and fresh herbs. It is served with appetizers, snacks, or tandoori food.
cuisines: Corn Spinach Salad is a fresh, colorful dish combining tender spinach leaves, sweet corn, crunchy walnuts, and tangy cranberries. Dressed with a sweet and tangy blend of cider vinegar, orange marmalade, and mayonnaise, it offers a perfect balance of flavors and textures.
method: In a small heavy skillet, cook walnuts over medium heat until toasted, about 3 minutes.
Sprinkle with sugar and vinegar, cooking and stirring until sugar is dissolved, 2–4 minutes.
Spread walnuts on foil to cool.
In a large bowl, combine spinach, red pepper, onion, corn, cheese, and cranberries.
Sprinkle with cooled walnuts.
In a small bowl, whisk together cider vinegar, orange marmalade, mayonnaise, salt, pepper, and Worcestershire sauce.
Serve salad with prepared dressing.

label: Beans Salad Dessecated Coconut
description: I love a good side salad - and this one is perfect for summer when beans are cheap! It's a great way to have them a little different then normal. It's SO delicious and is set to be a new fave.
cuisines: Beans Salad with Desiccated Coconut is a fresh, crunchy, and nutty dish combining green beans, toasted coconut, and peanuts with a tangy Asian-inspired dressing.
method: Slice the beans with a shredder and cut into 4 cm lengths. Place in a bowl with finely sliced chilli and add salt to taste.
Toast the peanuts in a hot wok, then add shredded coconut and stir until golden brown, watching carefully as it burns quickly.
Tip the hot coconut and peanuts over the beans to slightly soften them.
In a separate bowl, mix together hoisin tamari, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, sesame oil, and minced garlic.
Toss the dressing and bean sprouts with the green bean mixture.
Transfer to a serving bowl and top with fried shallots.

label: Gozpacho (Spain)
description: Gazpacho is a cold, spicy soup or drink that originated in the southern regions of Spain and Portugal. It's typically made from raw, blended vegetables, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, and garlic, along with water, olive oil, and vinegar.
cuisines: Gazpacho is a refreshing chilled Spanish soup made from ripe tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and garlic blended with olive oil and vinegar. Traditionally served cold, it’s perfect for hot summer days and bursts with fresh Mediterranean flavors.

ingredients.item: Red wine vinegar or sherry vinegar
Fresno chiles or red bell pepper, stemmed and seeded
Chopped cilantro, plus more for garnish
Corn tortillas (toasted or fried until crisp)

method: Marinate the vegetables with garlic, vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper for at least 3 hours, or preferably overnight, to allow flavors to meld.
If using a blender, blend at high speed for at least 2 minutes, pausing occasionally to scrape down the sides.
Slowly drizzle in olive oil while blending until smooth and emulsified. If watery, add more olive oil for a creamier texture.
To serve, top with basil, croutons, and a drizzle of oil.
In a large bowl, combine chopped cucumber, peppers, tomatoes, garlic, spring onions, bread, salt, and pepper.
Add sherry vinegar and olive oil, then mix by hand.
Blend the vegetable mixture until smooth.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
Serve ice cold with gazpacho ice cubes, chopped basil, olive oil, and toasts.

label: Harira (Morocco)
description: Harira is a hearty, flavorful, and traditional North African soup from Morocco and Algeria. It's made with a tomato base, lentils, chickpeas, warm spices, and fresh herbs, and is often thickened with broken vermicelli pasta or rice.
cuisines: Harira is a traditional Moroccan soup made with lentils, chickpeas, tomatoes, and warm spices. It is hearty, aromatic, and often enjoyed during Ramadan to break the fast.
method: Heat ghee in a pan.
Add saunth powder, jeera powder, and turmeric powder, and fry until fragrant.
Pour gur water into the spices.
Finely chop almonds and cashews, and add them to the mixture.
Bring the mixture to a boil, and cook for 3–4 minutes.
Basmati rice adds flavor, aroma, and texture, and thickens the soup.
Add more milk for a milkshake-like consistency, or less milk for a soupier consistency.
Soak dried chickpeas overnight before using them for richer flavor and better texture.

label: Mulligatawny (India)
description: Mulligatawny is a creamy, spiced, and flavorful soup that originated in South Indian cuisine during British-India. The name comes from the Tamil words miá¸·agu and taá¹‡á¹‡i, which literally translates to 'pepper water'.
cuisines: Mulligatawny is a spiced Indian-origin soup that blends lentils, chicken, vegetables, and fragrant spices. Often enriched with curry flavors and finished with lemon juice, it offers a warming and hearty balance of savory and tangy notes.

ingredients.item: Boneless skinless chicken thighs or breasts

method: In a casserole dish, heat butter and olive oil, then fry onions and celery with salt until softened and translucent.
Add carrots, parsnip, garlic, ginger, and apple and cook for one more minute.
Stir in curry powder, cumin, and paprika.
Add stock and tomato purée, then season to taste.
Rinse and cook rice in boiling water for 10 minutes.
Blend the soup until smooth.
Drain the rice and stir it into the soup with mango chutney, lemon juice, and half of the coriander.
Season to taste, then ladle into bowls and top with the remaining coriander and yogurt.

label: Laksa (Singapore)
description: Laksa is a spicy noodle soup that originated in Malaysia, Singapore, and Indonesia. It's made with a rich and spicy coconut curry soup or a broth seasoned with asam, and commonly includes thick rice noodles, chicken, prawns, or fish.
cuisines: Laksa is a flavorful Singaporean noodle soup combining rich coconut milk, aromatic spices, and fresh herbs. Often topped with chicken, prawns, or tofu, it delivers a fragrant, spicy, and creamy taste in every bowl.
method: Prepare the broth: Heat oil in a large saucepan, add laksa paste, and fry until fragrant and dark, about 10–15 minutes. Add water, lemongrass, and laksa leaves, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.

Add other ingredients: Add chicken or prawn stock, coconut milk, fish sauce, and other ingredients like garlic, ginger, chillies, palm sugar, tomato purée, peanut butter, sugar, and turmeric or saffron.
Cook protein: Add chicken or prawns and cook until colored, about 2–3 minutes.
Add noodles: Prepare noodles according to package directions, then add to the soup.
Simmer: Bring to a simmer and adjust to taste with lime juice and fish sauce.
Add toppings: Top with shredded chicken, beansprouts, or tofu puffs.

label: Yayla Corbasi (Turkey)
description: Yayla Ã§orbasÄ±, also known as yogurt Ã§orba or Turkish yogurt soup, is a traditional Turkish soup that's creamy, tangy, and comforting. The name translates to 'meadow soup' or 'highland soup' and is named after the high mountain meadows in northern Turkey where the soup originated.
cuisines: Yayla Çorbası is a traditional Turkish yogurt and rice soup flavored with mint or tarragon. Creamy, tangy, and comforting, it’s often served warm as a light meal or starter, especially in colder months.

ingredients.item: Water or half chicken stock and half water

method: Cook rice in a pot with water or half chicken stock and half water until it's soft.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt, egg, flour, and salt until smooth and creamy.
Gradually whisk boiling water into the yogurt mixture to warm it up without curdling.
Strain the yogurt mixture through a sieve, if desired.
Slowly ladle the rice and water mixture into the yogurt mixture, whisking gently.
Add the yogurt mixture back to the pot and simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Taste and add more salt if needed.

label: Mines Trone (Italy)
description: Minestrone is a thick, hearty Italian soup made with pasta, vegetables, and meat in a rich tomato broth. Here's a classic minestrone recipe that's high in fiber and vitamin C, but low in calories.
cuisines: Minestrone is a hearty Italian vegetable soup traditionally made with seasonal vegetables, beans, and pasta. It’s a wholesome, comforting dish with a rich broth enhanced by herbs and often a cheese rind for depth of flavor.
method: Balance the vegetables and starchy elements.
Cook the vegetables gradually, adding them in stages.
Cook the pasta separately so it doesn't get mushy.
Add a cheese rind to thicken the broth and give it an umami flavor.
Use small pasta because it's easier to eat and doesn't bloat as much in leftovers.
A simple vegetarian recipe that uses kidney beans, elbow pasta, and herbs like rosemary, basil, parsley, and bay leaf.

label: Tom Yum (Thailand)
description: Tom yum is a spicy, sour, and hot Thai soup that's usually made with shrimp. The name comes from the Thai words tom, which means 'boiling,' and yam, which means 'mixed'.
cuisines: Tom Yum is a classic Thai hot and sour soup known for its bold flavors from lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and fresh lime juice. It’s often made with prawns, mushrooms, and aromatic herbs, offering a perfect balance of spicy, sour, and savory.
method: Peel prawns, reserving the meat. In a pot, crush garlic, lemongrass, and chilies with a meat mallet to release flavor. Add the prawn heads and shells, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, stock, and water. Bring to a simmer, cover, and reduce heat to medium. Simmer for 10 minutes, then strain the broth and discard the prawn shells. Return the broth to the pot over low heat.

Add lime juice and pulp, chile peppers, lemongrass, ginger, tom yum paste, fish sauce, sugar, and chile sauce to the broth and cook for 10 minutes. Remove the chile peppers, lemongrass, and ginger slices with a slotted spoon and discard. Return cooked shrimp to the broth and remove from heat.
Add mushrooms and green onions to top the soup. You can also add tomato, coconut milk, soy sauce, tofu, and agave.
Season with salt to taste and garnish with cilantro or sawtooth coriander.

label: Tortilla (Mexico)
description: Tortilla soup is typically made with chicken broth, tomatoes, onions, garlic, and chilies, and served with shredded chicken, tortilla strips, cheese, avocado, crema, and cilantro.
cuisines: Tortilla soup is a traditional Mexican comfort dish made with a flavorful broth, crispy fried tortilla strips, and toppings like avocado, cheese, and crema. It blends savory, tangy, and smoky flavors into a hearty, satisfying bowl.
method: Fry tortillas in batches until golden brown.
In a deep pot over high heat, combine 4 cups of chicken broth, 2 cups of water, and tomato chile sauce.
Boil for 15–20 minutes and season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, add shredded chicken, tortilla strips, cheese, and cotija.
Pour about 1.5 cups of hot broth into the bowl.
Top with avocado, crema, and cilantro.
To toast chiles, hold them over a gas flame with tongs for a few seconds until they blister and smell fragrant.
You can use vegetable broth instead of chicken broth to make the soup vegan.
Optional toppings include tortilla chips, sour cream, Greek yogurt, and fresh diced tomatoes.

label: Bedmi puri (fried bread with lentil Jen Alling)
description: Tortilla soup is typically made with chicken broth, tomatoes, onions, garlic, and chilies, and served with shredded chicken, tortilla strips, cheese, avocado, crema, and cilantro.
cuisines: Tortilla soup is a traditional Mexican comfort dish made with a flavorful broth, crispy fried tortilla strips, and toppings like avocado, cheese, and crema. It blends savory, tangy, and smoky flavors into a hearty, satisfying bowl.
